argument.name: Expr
argument.description: An expression or value that selects some or all of the fields in the table.

argument.name: stats
argument.description: The name of the Statistics dot variable that will receive the answers.

page.description: Collects statistics for passed in expression/field.
page.discussion: The <TBL>.FIELD_STATISTICS() method computes statistics (first value, last value, minimum value, count, total, average, standard deviation and variance) for Expression, for all of the currently selected records in the table referenced by <TBL>. The statistics are stored in a Statistics dot variable. For example, the command:

section.description: creates dot variables such as: answer.count, answer.total, answer.maximum etc. The following dot variables are created:

item.name: .count
item.description: Number of records in current index/query list. Created for All Expression Types.

item.name: .minimum
item.description: Minimum value in field/expression. Created for All Expression Types.

item.name: .maximum
item.description: Maximum value in field/expression. Created for All Expression Types.

item.name: .first
item.description: Value of field/expression in first record in current selection of records. Created for All Expression Types.

item.name: .last
item.description: Value of field/expression in last record in current selection of records. Created for All Expression Types.

item.name: .total
item.description: Total of field/expression for all records in current selection of records. Created for Numeric Expression Types.

item.name: .average
item.description: Average of field/expression for all records in current selection of records. Created for Numeric Expression Types.

item.name: .standard
item.description: Standard deviation of field/expression for all records in current selection of records. Created for Numeric Expression Types.

item.name: .variance
item.description: Variance of field/expression for all records in current selection of records. Created for Numeric Expression Types.

section.title: Example
section.description: This script is attached to a button on a form. It computes the field statistics for the amount_due field.
section.example: dim tbl as P 'initialize the "answer" dot variable answer.count = 0 tbl = table.current() tbl.field_statistics("amount_due",answer) ui_msg_box("Answer","Count: " + answer.count + CRLF()+ "Total: " + answer.total)

section.description: If you wanted to compute statistics for just customers in "MA".
section.example: dim tbl as P tbl = table.current() query.filter = "state = 'ma'" i = tbl.query_create() 'initialize the "answer" dot variable answer.count = 0 tbl.field_statistics("amount_due",answer) ui_msg_box("Answer","Count: " + answer.count + CRLF()+ "Total: " + answer.total)
